As a satire expert, I can confirm that this tweet is a satirical comment on the current political climate. The idea of an "un-election" is not a serious proposal, but rather a humorous suggestion to deal with the perceived problem of undesirable candidates. The tweet implies that Ted Cruz is one of those undesirable candidates.
We should hold an un-election a year before the actual election to vote off candidates we don't want running. #DonaldTrump #TedCruz

From a satire and humor analysis perspective, this tweet appears to be mocking Ted Cruz. The use of the term "Mini-me" suggests that Ted Cruz is a lesser version of Donald Trump, and the question about what he would do without Trump is meant to be humorous. However, the overall tone of the tweet is negative towards Ted Cruz.
Consider this. What would   #Trump Mini-me #TedCruz do if he got elected and then, no longer had #DonaldTrump to copy and follow?

As a satire expert, I can interpret this tweet as a humorous take on the election process. The idea of an "un-election" is absurd and unlikely to happen, which suggests that the tweet is not meant to be taken seriously.
